description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.

description: Effective March 2 and until further notice, parents returning from areas considered at risk are asked not to send their children to school or daycare for 14 days following their day of return. Children who themselves went to these places cannot either go to school, same as teachers who went to these places. Students and teachers who are asked to stay home must work remotely from a digital workspace. On March 2, the areas considered at risk are: China (including Hong Kong and Macau) Taiwan, Singapore, Thailand, Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, Iran, Bahrain, Vietnam, Italy (Lombardy, Veneto, Emilia-Romagna), France (Oise (only this commune of Hauts-de-France)).
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Effective March 16 and until further notice, Monaco decided that kindergardens, primary schools and secondary schools have to stay close. However, these establishments can be maintained in operation to allow the continuation of the reception of the children of the personnel of the entities whose missions are strictly necessary for the public community. These entities are those specifically related to the production and distribution of goods or services essential to the satisfaction of the essential needs for the life of the Monegasque population, to the exercise of the authority of the State, to the functioning of the economy as well as to security of State. For parents who don't have any other solution the decision to accept their children in these day care centers will be made case by case. Reinforced aseptic measures are implemented in the structures maintained in operation. The teaching is done remotely.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Full remote distance learning,Regular cleaning and sanitary procedures applied to classrooms (e.g. classrooms must be aired out after each class) ,Special provisions exist for how teaching is done which applies to all teachers,Special provisions exist for some students in a school  (e.g. students living with essential workers can attend school while others must stay home)

description: Effective March 16 and until further notice, Monaco decided that kindergardens, primary schools and secondary schools have to stay close. However, these establishments can be maintained in operation to allow the continuation of the reception of the children of the personnel of the entities whose missions are strictly necessary for the public community. These entities are those specifically related to the production and distribution of goods or services essential to the satisfaction of the essential needs for the life of the Monegasque population, to the exercise of the authority of the State, to the functioning of the economy as well as to security of State. For parents who don't have any other solution the decision to accept their children in these day care centers will be made case by case. Reinforced aseptic measures are implemented in the structures maintained in operation. The teaching is done remotely. UPDATE: On March 17, Monaco specified that this policy will end on April 10.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Full remote distance learning,Regular cleaning and sanitary procedures applied to classrooms (e.g. classrooms must be aired out after each class) ,Special provisions exist for how teaching is done which applies to all teachers,Special provisions exist for some students in a school  (e.g. students living with essential workers can attend school while others must stay home)

description: Effective May 11 and until May 17, Monaco decided that in high school (lycée) and higher education, only those who are in these classes are allowed to be in school: 1st, Terminale and BTS. Parents of affected students can choose not to send their children to school. The canteen will remain closed and sports lessons will be suspended. Every students must keep a distance of 1,5 meter in school. Wearing a mask is mandatory for students and teachers. Classes open face-to-face operate in half-groups.

description: Effective March 16 and until further notice, Monaco decided that kindergardens, primary schools and secondary schools have to stay close. However, these establishments can be maintained in operation to allow the continuation of the reception of the children of the personnel of the entities whose missions are strictly necessary for the public community. These entities are those specifically related to the production and distribution of goods or services essential to the satisfaction of the essential needs for the life of the Monegasque population, to the exercise of the authority of the State, to the functioning of the economy as well as to security of State. For parents who don't have any other solution the decision to accept their children in these day care centers will be made case by case. Reinforced aseptic measures are implemented in the structures maintained in operation. The teaching is done remotely. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 11 because of a change of demographic target (some students are now allowed to go to school).

description: From June 8 and until further further notice, Monaco decided that the following establishments can welcome children under the age of 6: (1) care establishments and services ensuring non-permanent family care of children at home childminders; (2) reception establishments managed by a parents' association; (3) reception establishments which exclusively welcome children over 2 years old; (4) reception establishments of 10 places. Measures to respect: (1) only 1 parent per child can enter; (2) take the temperature, on arrival, of staff and children; (3) wash children's hands and faces as often as possible; (4) staff have enough masks and hydro-alcoholic products and wash their hands frequently; (5) soap and hygienic means of drying in toilets; (6) clean and disinfect frequently; (7) avoid using toys difficult to clean; (8) favor outside activities; (9) form small groups (10 children/group if possible); (10) no event bringing together adults and children; (11) wearing a mask for all those over 5; (12) hydro-alcoholic product at entrances, toilets and where necessary; (13) at the entrance, a reminder of barrier gestures and the maximum number of people; (14) distance of 1.50 m between people; (15) a direction of circulation; (16) ventilation in perfect condition; (17) dry disinfectant welcome mats where carpet is; (18) ventilate regularly. breaches are punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2d time and 1000-2250 € if more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Effective March 22 and until March 31, Monaco implemented a curfew from 10 pm to 5 am. Exception: (1) travel to purchase supplies necessary for professional activity and essential purchases in establishments and local businesses authorized to welcome the public; (2) short trips, close to home, related to the individual physical activity of people or the needs of pets. Any breach is punishable of a fine from 75 to 200 euros.

description: Effective March 11 and until further notice, Monaco decided that any cruise ship stopover at the quay or at anchor in Monegasque waters is canceled. Infractions expose their perpetrators to prosecution and penalties provided for in article L 770.1 of the Code of the Sea. For a first infraction, the fine if from 600 to 1000 euros. If there is a recurrence, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros and/or imprisonment from 6 days to 1 month.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Effective March 11 and until further notice, Monaoc decided that the captain of a ship making an international voyage has to transmit the medical declaration of health provided for by article 37 of the International Health Regulations, 48 hours before arriving in Monegasque waters. All vessels over 24 meters will also have to transmit this medical declaration of health. This policy applies to ships flying the Monegasque flag, with the exception of government ships, and to all ships flying the foreign flag. Infractions expose their perpetrators to prosecution and penalties provided for in article L 770.1 of the Code of the Sea. For a first infraction, the fine if from 600 to 1000 euros. If there is a recurrence, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros and/or imprisonment from 6 days to 1 month.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Effective March 11 and until further notice, Monaco asked (without forcing it) helicopter societies that serve the Principality from a risk zone to check the temperature of their passengers before boarding. The areas considered at risk are: China (including Hong Kong and Macau) Taiwan, Singapore, Thailand, Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, Iran, Bahrain, Vietnam, Italy (Lombardy, Veneto, Emilia-Romagna, Marche, and provinces of Alessandria, Asti and Turin in Piedmont), France (Aude and Calvados departments and the following municipalities: Les contamines-Montjoie, La Balme-de-Sillingy, Crépy-en-Valois, Creil, Mulhouse, Auray, Crash, Carnac, Doubs, Ajaccio), Germany (Würtemberg (only this region of Bade-Wurtemberg), Bayern, Nordrhein-Westfalen), Spain (Madrid, Andalusia, Basque Country, Castille-La-Mancha, Castile and Leon, Catalonia, La Rioja, Valencia), San Marino, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Austria, Netherlands, Switzerland (Ticino, Vaud, Geneva, Basel, Zurich), United States (Washington State, New York State, California, Massachusset). In the event of a fever above 38 C°, a decision will be taken in consultation with the company and Monegasque civil aviation.

description: From March 18 and until March 31, Monaco imposed confinement on its territory. Non-Monegasque resident are only autorized to cross Monegasque border if they have a valid professional reason. They must be provided with a certificate completed by their employer attesting to the need to travel to Monaco. An agreement has been concluded with France to allow these people to travel on French territory to get to Monaco. Border checks will be made by the police. UPDATE: The lockdown is extended until April 15, and so are the border controls. Furthermore, any breach is punishable of a fine from 75 to 200 euros.

description: Effective May 27 and until further notice, Monaco decided that any new call by vessels flying a foreign flag in a Monegasque port or at anchor is limited to a maximum distance of 54 nautical miles from the home port or the vessel's mooring buoy. Any yacht with crew absent from the ports of Monaco for at least 48 hours must send a medical declaration of health (DMS) to the Maritime and Airport Police Division of the Public Security Directorate. Other ships wishing to make a stopover in Monaco will have to comply with the health protocol decided by the COVID 19 cell and transmit a DMS 48 hours before any stopover. description: Travelers are required to quarantine unless they are able to show proof of a negative PCR test taken at most 72 hours prior to arrival. In the event of a positive PCR, or if the person refuses to be tested, the quarantine will be maintained.

description: Anyone who enters Monaco from the Departments of the Alpes Maritimes and Var beyond the 24-hour deadline or from an area beyond the Alpes Maritimes and Var Departments or from a foreign country has to reach out to the COVID19 Call Center upon arrival and will be subject to a quarantine. The quarantine can be avoided if the person can provide a negative PCR test results (at most 72 hours before arrival). The quarantine can be shortened if the person performs a PCR test in a laboratory in Monaco. In case of a positive PCR or refusal to be tested, the quarantine will be maintained.   Exceptions for cross-border workers.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Anyone aged 11 or over, whatever their nationality, who enters the Principality and comes from a foreign country must be able to justify, in the event of a control by the Monegasque authorities, the negative result of a PCR test, carried out less 72 hours before arriving in the Principality.Are not subject to this obligation, provided you do not stay in a patelin establishment in Monaco: Commuter workers, pupils and cross-border students, Residents of the French departments of Alpes-Maritimes or Var coming to the Principality for less than 24 hours, Professionals from companies established abroad coming to the national territory to perform a service the urgency or frequency of which is incompatible with the performance of the test mentioned in article 3, provided that they are not accommodated at Monaco, Road transport professionals coming to the national territory in the exercise of their activity for a period not exceeding 24 hours.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Travelers to Monaco must provide evidence of a negative PCR test taken with 72 hours of travel. In the absence of a negative test, travelers will be required to quarantine. Anyone aged 11 or over and coming from South Africa, Argentina, Brazil, Chile or India must, in addition to the PCR test, either quarantine for 7 days and perform a new PCR test at the end of the isolation period or present the negative result of two new PCR tests, the first carried out within 24 hours of their arrival and the second carried out 5 to 7 days later.This quarantine may be shortened if the person performs a PCR test in a medical biology laboratory.

In the event of a positive PCR, or if the person refuses to be tested, the quarantine will be maintained.

The quarantine can be shortened if the person performs a PCR test to be performed in a medical biology laboratory (laboratory in the Principality of Monaco appearing on this list) In the event of a positive PCR, or if the person refuses to be tested, the quarantine will be maintained.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Regardless of nationality, anyone aged 11 or over, who wishes to enter the Principality must be able to present all the documents required for their zone of origin (green zone, orange zone, red zone) on arrival and provide one of the following: a negative PCR test taken within 48 hours of arrival, evidence of full vaccination, or a certificate showing proof of recovery from Covid-19.    People arriving from 'orange' countries must provide a negative PCR test and proof of full vaccination (or evidence of having recovered from Covid-19). Travelers from 'red' countries must present evidence that their trip is for a "compelling reason" and a negative PCR test. Additionally, they must self-isolate for 7 days on arrival or present the negative result of two new PCR tests, the first carried out within 24 hours of their arrival and the second carried out 5 to 7 days later.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry)

description: Effective January 30 and until further notice, Monaco decided that only people exposed for less than 14 days, having stayed in China or having been in close contact with a person infected with the COVID-19 and presenting a lower respiratory infection (cough and fever) are considered as suspicious. People who think they are infected should not go to their doctor or hospital, but stay at home. They must call the Monaco Fire Department, in contact with a specialist doctor from the Princess Grace Hospital Center, who will determine the action to be taken.

description: Effective February 28 and until further notice, Monaco decided that all contact subjects of confirmed cases of COVID-19 will have to take their temperature twice a day and be monitored medically. Is considered a contact subject: any person who has touched or who has remained within 2 meters for more than 15 minutes of the person suffering from COVID-19; anyone who has spoken with the COVID-19 patient; anyone who has cleaned the body fluids of the COVID-19 patient without protection; the group of close friends; anyone living in the same home or attending the same dormitory as the COVID-19 patient.

On February 28, Monaco specified that from now on and until further notice, its residents should avoid contact and take their temperature twice a day during 14 days if they are coming back from any areas considered at risk. Since February 27, the areas considered at risk are: China (including Hong Kong and Macau), Singapore, South Korea, Thailand, Japan, Taiwan, Malaysia, Iran, Bahrain and the regions of Lombardy, Veneto and Emilia-Romagna in Italy.

description: Since February 24, Monaco aks everyone who went to a specific area (China, Hong-Kong, Macau, Singapore, Thailand, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Malaysia, Italy (only Lombardy and Veneto)) to avoid contact and take their temperature twice a day. On February 28, Monaco specified that from now on and until further notice, its residents should avoid contact and take their temperature twice a day during 14 days if they are coming back from any areas considered at risk. Since February 27, the areas considered at risk are: China (including Hong Kong and Macau), Singapore, South Korea, Thailand, Japan, Taiwan, Malaysia, Iran, Bahrain and the regions of Lombardy, Veneto and Emilia-Romagna in Italy. UPDATE: The policy ends on March 2 because of a change in geographical target.

description: Effective March 11 and until further notice, Monaco decided that any captain of a ship going to a Monegasque port or at anchor, suspecting the presence on board of a patient with COVID-19, must report it to CROSS MED. This case will be dealt with in the case of the medical procedure at sea. The disembarkation or embarkation at sea of persons on board the vessel with suspected cases of persons infected with the virus is prohibited without the prior consent of the Minister of State or of any agent having general delegation. This policy applies to ships flying the Monegasque flag, with the exception of government ships, and to all ships flying the foreign flag. Infractions expose their perpetrators to prosecution and penalties provided for in article L 770.1 of the Code of the Sea. If there is a recurrence, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros and/or imprisonment from 6 days to 1 month.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: A snapshot of a person’s health at a given point in time
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Effective March 23 and until further notice, Monaco ordered that any doctor who notices that a person has the symptoms of the COVID-19 disease or is affected by it has to make a declaration, as soon as possible and by any means, to the Department of Health Action.

description: Since January 30, Monaco decided that only people exposed for less than 14 days, having stayed in China or having been in close contact with a person infected with the COVID-19 and presenting a lower respiratory infection (cough and fever) are considered as suspicious. People who think they are infected should not go to their doctor or hospital, but stay at home. They must call the Monaco Fire Department, in contact with a specialist doctor from the Princess Grace Hospital Center who will determine the action to be taken. Effective February 27 and until further notice, Monaco changed the areas considered at risk. These areas are now: China (including Hong-Kong and Macau), Singapore, Thailand, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Malaysia, Iran, Bahrain and Italy (only in Lombardy and Veneto).
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: A snapshot of a person’s health at a given point in time

description: From May 18 to August 31 and retroactive until May 1, Monaco decided that the result, whether positive or negative, of any test detecting anti-SARS-CoV-2 antibodies, SARS-CoV-2 virus RNA or its antigens carried out on a person residing on Monegasque territory, beneficiary of compulsory health insurance under a Monegasque social security scheme or one educated on Monegasque territory is declared, as soon as possible and by any means, to the Department of Health Action by the person under whose responsibility this test has been carried out.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: A snapshot of a person’s health at a given point in time
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 20 and until further notice, Monaco authorizes the implementation of an automated processing of personal information intended to allow: (1) the creation of a list identifying people residing in Monaco, beneficiaries of compulsory health insurance under a Monegasque social security scheme or educated in Monegasque territory, in order to ensure the follow-up of the epidemiological situation in Monaco; (2) collecting the result of any test detecting anti-SARS-CoV-2 antibodies, SARS-CoV-2 virus RNA or its antigens, performed on one of these persons; (3) the extraction or use of health data contained in this processing as part of the policy to combat the spread of COVID-19 or for research purposes. This extraction can only be performed if it concerns irreversibly anonymized health data. The information that may be included in the processing is the name, first name, date of birth, gender, address of residence, telephone number, e-mail address, profession and place of practice. profession or education, and, where applicable, those of its legal representatives. Access to information is exclusively reserved: (1) to medical inspectors of the Department of Health Action; (2) to the persons responsible for ensuring the technical management of the treatment; (3) to the persons responsible for the administrative management of the processing. All personal information is irreversibly anonymized on May 31, 2021. This processing can then only be used for research purposes.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Monaco has created their version of a health pass. Named the "Monaco Safe Pass", it will prove a person is either vaccinated, fully recovered from Covid or has tested negative. Measures: Anyone fully vaccinated, taking a PCR  after the 5 July will receive the health pass on site.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 12 and until further notice, national government autorizes doctors working as Hospital Practitioners at the Princess Grace Hospital Center and those who have signed the Convention of 2006 February 1 (Convention du 1er février 2006 entre la Caisse de Compensation des Services Sociaux, la Caisse d'Assurance Maladie Maternité des Travailleurs Indépendants et l'Ordre des médecins de la Principauté de Monaco) and practicing general medicine, pediatrics or pneumology to set up a remote consultation for the benefit of their patients affiliated to a Monegasque social security scheme (Social Services Compensation Fund, Sickness and Maternity Insurance Fund for Self-Employed Workers or State Medical Benefits Service).

description: Effective March 17, national government of Monaco autorized pharmacies to dispense, within the framework of the initially planned dosage, a number of boxes of medicine per prescription line guaranteeing the continuation of the treatment until May 31, when the period of validity of a renewable prescription has expired. However, drugs that are narcotic or to which the regulation of narcotics is applied in whole or in part in accordance with the laws or regulations in force are excluded.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 17 and until May 31, Monaco authorized pharmaceutical establishments for the manufacture of medicinal products for human use, establishments for the manufacture of cosmetic products and establishments for the manufacture of biocidal products to manufacture and sell on the market hydro-alcoholic biocidal products intended for human hygiene. The conditions for the preparation, formulation and use of hydro-alcoholic solutions (composition, labeling, storage and release of batches) are provided for in the annex to the ministerial decision establishing this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 11 and until May 31, hydro-alcoholic solutions intended for human hygiene can be prepared by dispensing pharmacies and pharmacies for indoor use. description: Effective March 19 and until May 31, Monaco decided that the retail prices of the hydro-alcoholic products intended for personal hygiene mentioned must not exceed: (1) for containers with a volume less than or equal to 50 milliliters, 40 euros per liter all taxes included, i.e. a price unit per bottle of 50 milliliters maximum of 2 euros all taxes included; (2) for containers with a volume greater than 50 milliliters and less than or equal to 100 milliliters, 30 euros all taxes included per liter, ie a maximum unit price per bottle of 100 milliliters of 3 euros all taxes included; (3) for containers with a volume greater than 100 milliliters and less than or equal to 300 milliliters, 16 euros and 70 centimes all taxes included per liter, i.e. a maximum unit price per bottle of 300 milliliters of 5 euros all taxes included; (4) for containers with a volume greater than 300 milliliters, 28 euros all taxes included per liter, i.e. a maximum unit price per bottle of 500 milliliters of 14 euros all taxes included.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective March 19 and until May 31, Monaco decided that wholesale prices intended for resale of hydro-alcoholic products intended for personal hygiene must not exceed: (1) for containers with a volume less than or equal to 50 milliliters, 30 euros excluding tax per liter; (2) for containers with a volume greater than 50 milliliters and less than or equal to 100 milliliters, 20 euros excluding tax per liter; (3) for containers with a volume greater than 100 milliliters and less than or equal to 300 milliliters, 10 euros excluding tax per liter; (4) for containers with a volume greater than 300 milliliters, 8 euros excluding tax per liter. A correction coefficient is applied to the maximum selling prices when hydro-alcoholic solutions are prepared by pharmacies. This coefficient is fixed at: (1) 1.5 for containers of 300 milliliters or less; (2) 1.3 for containers over 300 milliliters.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 23 and until April 15, Monaco decided that healthcare establishments whose corporate purpose does not allow the support of patients affected or likely to be affected by the COVID-19 disease are authorized to carry out any activity to support these patients.

description: On March 24, Monaco decided that until May 31, the Director of Health Action may pre-empt from wholesalers-distributors, in particular from the pharmaceutical establishment of the Monegasque public limited company “Comptoir Pharmaceutique Méditerranéen”, all or part of the compound specialties of hydroxychloroquine, chloroquine or azithromycin in their possession, subject to leaving them the necessary quantities to distribute to Monegasque pharmacies in order to ensure the treatment of patients benefiting from a medical prescription in accordance with the marketing authorization for said specialties.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 24, Monaco decided that until May 31, the Director of Health Action can preempt from the company “Comptoir Pharmaceutique Méditerranéen” and pharmacies all or part of the specialties composed of hydroxychloroquine, chloroquine or azithromycin in their possession or which will be in their possession until May 31. The Director of Health Action supplies, as necessary, these specialties thus pre-empted to: (1) the pharmacy for internal use of the Princess Grace Hospital Center in order to allow clinical trials to be carried out within the framework of the fight against COVID-19 or to provide treatment for patients infected with COVID-19; (2) a dispensing pharmacy appointed by the Director of Health Action in order to ensure the treatment of patients benefiting from a medical prescription in accordance with the marketing authorization for said specialties.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 24, Monaco decided that until May 31, the dispensing by pharmacies for internal use of any specialty consisting of hydroxychloroquine, such as Plaquenil, or chloroquine, such as Nivaquine, is prohibited, apart from clinical trials, when this medicinal product has been prescribed either in a dosage which does not comply with its marketing authorization, or in combination with any medicinal product composed of azithromycin, such as Zithromax.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Effective March 27 and until further notice, Monaco decided that hydroxychloroquine and the lopinavir/ritonavir combination can be prescribed, dispensed and administered, under the responsibility of a physician, to patients affected by COVID-19 in the health establishments that treat them, as well as, for the continuation of their treatment if their condition allows it and with the authorization of the initial prescriber, at home. These prescriptions come into effect, after collegial decision, in compliance with the recommendations of the French High Council for Public Health and, in particular, the indication for patients with oxygen-requiring pneumonia or organ failure.

description: Effective March 30 and until further notice, Monaco decided that in support of the CHPG (which will house all COVID-19 patients), the IM2S will accommodate trauma orthopedics patients, except: children under 5; head trauma; patients with neurovascular deficit; multiple trauma patients requiring a multidisciplinary team or intensive care; Covid-19 patients and requiring trauma care. The medical regulation of Emergencies remains ensured by the CHPG. The IM2S will also receive certain patients referred by the Cardio-thoracic Center of Monaco (CCM). Under the aegis of the Department of Social Affairs and Health, all outpatient consultations and scheduled interventions have been postponed. Only emergency activity is covered.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 31, Monaco decided that the dispensing pharmacist may renew, within the framework of the initially planned dosage, the delivery of drugs containing substances with hypnotic or anxiolytic properties, provided that these drugs have been dispensed to the patient for at least three consecutive months. This issue cannot be guaranteed for a period exceeding 28 days. It is renewable until April 15, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective March 31, Monaco decided that in the case of opioid substitution treatment of at least three months based on methadone in the form of capsules, of methadone in the form of syrup or of buprenorphine tablets, when the period of validity of the last prescription has expired, the dispensary pharmacist whose dispensary is mentioned on the prescription may, after agreement of the prescribing physician, dispense, within the framework of the dosage and the initial fractionation procedures defined by this doctor, a number of boxes per prescription line guaranteeing continuation of treatment. The delivery can be ensured for a period not exceeding 28 days, including for methadone in the form of syrup. It is renewable until April 15, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective March 31, Monaco decided that within the framework of the care of the patient treated by narcotic drugs or coming under the narcotics regime, when the period of validity of the last prescription has expired, the dispensing pharmacist and the pharmacist managing the pharmacy of the Center Hospitalier Princesse Grace, having previously dispensed these drugs to the patient, may, with the written consent of the prescribing physician, dispense, within the framework of the dosage and the terms of fractionation initially defined by this doctor, a number of boxes per prescription line guaranteeing the continuation of treatment. This doctor may supplement the written agreement mentioned in the previous paragraph with a new prescription meeting regulatory requirements, if he considers it necessary to adjust the dosage. Delivery may be insured for a period not exceeding 28 days. It is renewable until April 15.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective March 31, Monaco decided that in the context of chronic treatment, when the period of validity of a renewable prescription has expired, the dispensing pharmacist, the provider of services or the equipment distributor may deliver, until April 15, 2020, within the framework of the prescription initially provided for, a volume of products or services guaranteeing the continuation of treatment. If necessary, this issue may be made beyond the validity date of the prior agreement of the social security organization providing support linked to the prescription. The products or services covered by this poliy are: (1) medical devices, materials and products for the treatment of specific pathologies; (2) medical devices for home support and life support for sick or disabled people; (3) items for dressings and restraint materials.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 17, national government of Monaco autorized pharmacies to dispense, within the framework of the initially planned dosage, a number of boxes of medicine per prescription line guaranteeing the continuation of the treatment until May 31, when the period of validity of a renewable prescription has expired. However, drugs that are narcotic or to which the regulation of narcotics is applied in whole or in part in accordance with the laws or regulations in force are excluded. UPDATE: On March 31, Monaco repealed that policy.

description: Effective April 1 and until May 31, Monaco decided that when the period of validity of a prescription prescribing nursing care has expired, the nurse may continue (under the conditions provided for by the initial prescription) the following care: nursing care related to a long-term illness, including treatment prolonged and particularly expensive therapy, which appears on the list provided for in article 2 of ministerial decree n° 94-365; nursing care in connection with a serious serious condition not appearing on the said list or several conditions leading to an invalidating pathological state, provided that the patient is recognized as having it by the social security body to which he is responsible and that this or these conditions require prolonged treatment and particularly expensive therapy; nursing care requiring the prescription of medical devices provided for by I of article 1 of ministerial decree n° 2007-647; monitoring of drug intake for patients with psychiatric disorders and cognitive disorders; home nursing care for a dependent patient; the sample as part of the prescription of a surveillance biology examination of a chronic pathology.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective April 1 and until further notice, a dedicated telephone platform for anonymous listening and support is deployed in Monaco. On this platform, professionals will listen and provide guidance on the best way to experience this pandemic period from a personal and emotional point of view. Callers can contact either Monegasque Red Cross volunteers trained in listening, or city psychologists, or, if necessary, a doctor, in conjunction with the Medico-Psychological Emergency Unit of the Princess Grace Hospital Center.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 2 and until further notice, doctors and midwives who have signed the Convention of February 1, 2006 (Convention du 1er février 2006 entre la Caisse de Compensation des Services Sociaux, la Caisse d'Assurance Maladie Maternité des Travailleurs Indépendants et l'Ordre des médecins de la Principauté de Monaco) are authorized by Monaco to set up a remote consultation through information and communication technologies, for the benefit of their patients affiliated to one of the Monegasque social security schemes (Social Services Compensation Fund, Sickness and Maternity Insurance Fund for Self-Employed Workers, State Medical Benefits Service). For midwives, this consultation concerns: the first session of preparation for birth and parenthood; the following birth and parenting preparation sessions given to (1) a single woman or couple or (2) two or more women or couples simultaneously and up to a maximum of six women or couples; the assessment valuing the prevention missions of midwives carried out from the declaration of pregnancy and if possible before the twenty-fourth week of amenorrhea.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective April 3 and until May 31, Monaco decided that hydro-alcoholic solutions intended for human hygiene can be prepared, in the event of a failure in their supply and subject to having suitable premises, by dispensing pharmacies and pharmacies for internal use. These hydro-alcoholic solutions are prepared under the conditions recommended by the World Health Organization.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 6 and until further notice, Monaco decided that veterinary medicinal products benefiting from a marketing authorization mentioned in article 9 of law n ° 1.257, with the same therapeutic aim, the same active substance, the same dosage and the same route of administration as the said specialties may be prescribed, prepared, dispensed and administered in a hospital setting. The list of these drugs and their active ingredients, as well as their preparation and use conditions, are those set by the French National Agency for the Safety of Medicines and Health Products published on its website. These drugs are used according to these particular conditions of use for a patient, in view of his clinical condition.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 6 and until May 31, Monaco decided that the pharmaceutical specialty based on belatacept can be dispensed to the public by the pharmacy for internal use of the Princess Grace Hospital Center to guarantee maintenance treatments for graft rejection in adult patients who have received a renal transplant. The pharmacy for internal use delivers, on the basis of the hospital prescription, the pharmaceutical specialty mentioned in the first paragraph and provides a protocol for the administration of the treatment as well as the other medical prescriptions necessary for the care of the patient at his home. Based on the medical prescription, the administration of the pharmaceutical specialty is carried out by a nurse at the patient's home in accordance with the treatment administration protocol provided by the pharmacy for internal use.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 6, Monaco's Committee for the Promotion and Protection of Women's Rights implemented two new measures to strengthen aid and emergency systems. To multiply the points of contact during COVID 19, it is now possible to report violence to the pharmacy and send the alert by e-mail to the police.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 14 and until May 31, Monaco decided that the price of surgical masks cannot exceed 2.50 euros (all taxes includes) the unit, and the price of FFP2 masks cannot exceed 7.50 euros (all taxes includes) the unit. Any breach is punishable of a fine from 75 to 200 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective April 14 and until May 31, Monaco decided that only surgical masks bearing the CE marking and whose labeling includes the indications provided for in point 13.3 of appendix I of ministerial decree n ° 2003-581 of 10 November 2003 may be sold under the name of surgical masks. In addition, only those FFP2 masks bearing the CE marking and accompanied by the required documents and the instructions and information provided for in point 1.4 of Annex II of Regulation (EU) 2016/425 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 9 March 2016 on personal protective equipment may be sold under the name of FFP2 masks. Any breach is punishable of a fine from 75 to 200 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective April 14 and until May 31, Monaco decided that the retail sale of surgical masks or FFP2 masks is limited to a "reasonable quantity" per person. Any breach is punishable of a fine from 75 to 200 euros.

description: Effective March 31, Monaco decided that within the framework of the care of the patient treated by narcotic drugs or coming under the narcotics regime, when the period of validity of the last prescription has expired, the dispensing pharmacist and the pharmacist managing the pharmacy of the Center Hospitalier Princesse Grace, having previously dispensed these drugs to the patient, may, with the written consent of the prescribing physician, dispense, within the framework of the dosage and the terms of fractionation initially defined by this doctor, a number of boxes per prescription line guaranteeing the continuation of treatment. This doctor may supplement the written agreement mentioned in the previous paragraph with a new prescription meeting regulatory requirements, if he considers it necessary to adjust the dosage. Delivery may be insured for a period not exceeding 28 days. It is renewable until April 15. UPDATE: On April 3, Monaco decided that this policy would finaly end on May 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective March 31, Monaco decided that in the context of chronic treatment, when the period of validity of a renewable prescription has expired, the dispensing pharmacist, the provider of services or the equipment distributor may deliver, until April 15, 2020, within the framework of the prescription initially provided for, a volume of products or services guaranteeing the continuation of treatment. If necessary, this issue may be made beyond the validity date of the prior agreement of the social security organization providing support linked to the prescription. The products or services covered by this poliy are: (1) medical devices, materials and products for the treatment of specific pathologies; (2) medical devices for home support and life support for sick or disabled people; (3) items for dressings and restraint materials. UPDATE: On April 3, Monaco decided that this policy would finaly end on May 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective March 23 and until April 15, Monaco decided that healthcare establishments whose corporate purpose does not allow the support of patients affected or likely to be affected by the COVID-19 disease are authorized to carry out any activity to support these patients. UPDATE: Monaco decided that this policy would finaly end on May 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 31 and until April 15, Monaco decided that the pharmaceutical specialty Rivotril® in injectable form can be dispensed by dispensing pharmacies for the treatment of patients affected or likely to be affected by the COVID-19 whose clinical condition warrants it upon presentation of a medical prescription bearing the words “Prescription Outside Marketing Authorization in the context of COVID-19”. UPDATE: Monaco decided that this policy will finaly end on May 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective April 17 and until May 31, Monaco decided that when supply difficulties in in vitro diagnostic medical devices prevent medical biology laboratories from carrying out examinations to detect the SARS-CoV-2 genome by RT PCR in sufficient numbers to cope with the health crisis, they may use in vitro diagnostic medical devices that do not have a CE marking when the following conditions are met: (1) the in vitro diagnostic medical device meets harmonized standards or the technical specifications of the European Union, it complies with the validation procedure of the French national reference center “Respiratory infection viruses (including influenza)” and is validated by this center before it is put into service; (2) the laboratory manager informs this center before using these devices for the first time and keeps the relevant technical documentation at his disposal.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective April 17 and until May 31, Monaco decided that when the medical biology laboratories are not able to carry out the examination for detection of the SARS-CoV-2 genome by RT PCR or to carry out in sufficient number to face the health crisis, the Director of Health Action may authorize laboratories using molecular biology equipment and techniques, including research laboratories, to perform the analytical phase of this examination. Said examination is carried out under the responsibility of a medical biology laboratory appointed, with the agreement of the latter, by the Director of Health Action. It gives rise to an examination report validated by the medical biologist and mentioning the name and address of the laboratory which carried out the analytical phase.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: From April 17, Monaco has decided to distribute 2 masks free of charge to each of the employees and residents of the Principality. The masks will be made of approved fabric, washable and reusable for one month. First of all, all residents aged 65 and over will receive their masks by teams from the Town Hall of Monaco. Then, residents aged 16 to 65 will receive their masks by post. Finally, children under 16 will also receive their masks, adapted to their size, by post. Regarding employees, the Government will record requests for masks made by the various branches of activity.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since March 17, Monaco authorizes pharmaceutical establishments for the manufacture of medicinal products for human use, establishments for the manufacture of cosmetic products and establishments for the manufacture of biocidal products to manufacture and sell on the market hydro-alcoholic biocidal products intended for human hygiene. Effective April 27 and until September 1, this policy is still in force. However, Monaco changed the conditions for the preparation, formulation and use of hydro-alcoholic solutions (composition, labeling, storage and release of batches). The new conditions are provided for in the annex of the ministerial decision establishing this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 27 and until further notice, Monaco decided to benefit from its supply chains to all employers in the Principality. The latter can thus buy (at 1 € excluding tax) alternative masks. To generalize this distribution to all employers, facilitate ordering of these masks and optimize the recovery time, a Teleservice will be put online.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 17 and until May 31, Monaco authorized pharmaceutical establishments for the manufacture of medicinal products for human use, establishments for the manufacture of cosmetic products and establishments for the manufacture of biocidal products to manufacture and sell on the market hydro-alcoholic biocidal products intended for human hygiene. The conditions for the preparation, formulation and use of hydro-alcoholic solutions (composition, labeling, storage and release of batches) are provided for in the annex to the ministerial decision establishing this policy. UPDATE: The policy ends on April 27 because of a change in the conditions in which hydro alcoholic solutions have to be prepared.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 30 and until further notice, Monaco decided that in support of the CHPG (which will house all COVID-19 patients), the IM2S will accommodate trauma orthopedics patients, except: children under 5; head trauma; patients with neurovascular deficit; multiple trauma patients requiring a multidisciplinary team or intensive care; Covid-19 patients and requiring trauma care. The medical regulation of Emergencies remains ensured by the CHPG. The IM2S will also receive certain patients referred by the Cardio-thoracic Center of Monaco (CCM). Under the aegis of the Department of Social Affairs and Health, all outpatient consultations and scheduled interventions have been postponed. Only emergency activity is covered. UPDATE: The policy ends on April 27. The Princess Grace Hospital Center (CHPG) takes over the activity of treating trauma-medico-surgical emergencies.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 28 and until May 31, Monaco decided that the dispensing by dispensing pharmacies of specialties containing nicotine and used in the treatment of tobacco dependence is limited to the number of boxes necessary for a treatment lasting one month.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 29 and until further notice, pharmacists can advise, dispense and sell in their pharmacy non-sanitary masks (fabric masks) manufactured according to an industrial process and meeting the applicable technical specifications.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 4 and until August 31, Monaco decided that retail prices of hydro-alcoholic products intended for personal hygiene cannot exceed: (1) 35.17 euros with taxes per liter for containers with a volume less than or equal to 50 ml; (2) 26.38 euros with taxes per liter for containers with a volume greater than 50 ml and less than or equal to 100 ml; (3) 14.68 euros with taxes per liter for containers with a volume greater than 100 ml and less than or equal to 300 ml; (4) 5 euros with taxes per liter for containers with a volume greater than 300 ml. A correction coefficient is applied to the maximum selling prices when hydro-alcoholic solutions are prepared by dispensing pharmacies. This coefficient is 1.5 for containers of 300 ml or less and 1.3 for containers of more than 300 ml. For bulk sales, this coefficient is set at 1.2 for containers of 300 ml or less and at 1.1 for containers of more than 300 ml. A correction coefficient of 1.3 is applied to the maximum selling prices when either: (1) the containers are more than 300 ml and the containers are vials for dispensers equipped with an elbow plunger mechanism or cartridges or refills intended for manual distribution boxes fitted with a push button or refills intended for contactless distribution boxes; (2) the products are packaged in single-dose sachets corresponding to a volume of less than 5 ml. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective May 4 and until August 31, Monaco decided that Wholesale prices intended for the resale of hydro-alcoholic products intended for personal hygiene may not exceed: (1) 30 euros excluding tax per liter for containers with a volume less than or equal to 50 ml; (2) 20 euros excluding tax per liter for containers with a volume greater than 50 ml and less than or equal to 100 ml; (3) 10 euros excluding tax per liter for containers corresponding to a volume greater than 100 ml and less than or equal to 300 ml; (4) 8 euros excluding tax per liter for containers corresponding to a volume greater than 300 ml. A corrective coefficient is applied to the maximum selling prices when hydro-alcoholic solutions are prepared by pharmacies. This coefficient is 1.5 for containers of 300 ml or less and 1.3 for containers of more than 300 ml. For bulk sales, this coefficient is set at 1.2 for containers of 300 ml or less and at 1.1 for containers of more than 300 ml. A correction coefficient of 1.3 is applied to the maximum selling prices when either: (1) the containers are greater than 300 ml and the containers are vials for dispensers fitted with an angled piston mechanism or cartridges or refills intended for manual distribution boxes fitted with a push button or refills intended for contactless distribution boxes; (2) the products are packaged in single-dose sachets corresponding to a volume of less than 5 ml. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective March 19 and until May 31, Monaco decided that wholesale prices intended for resale of hydro-alcoholic products intended for personal hygiene must not exceed: (1) for containers with a volume less than or equal to 50 milliliters, 30 euros excluding tax per liter; (2) for containers with a volume greater than 50 milliliters and less than or equal to 100 milliliters, 20 euros excluding tax per liter; (3) for containers with a volume greater than 100 milliliters and less than or equal to 300 milliliters, 10 euros excluding tax per liter; (4) for containers with a volume greater than 300 milliliters, 8 euros excluding tax per liter. A correction coefficient is applied to the maximum selling prices when hydro-alcoholic solutions are prepared by pharmacies. This coefficient is fixed at: (1) 1.5 for containers of 300 milliliters or less; (2) 1.3 for containers over 300 milliliters. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 4 because Monaco changed the forecast prices of hydro-alcoholic products.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective March 19 and until May 31, Monaco decided that the retail prices of the hydro-alcoholic products intended for personal hygiene mentioned must not exceed: (1) for containers with a volume less than or equal to 50 milliliters, 40 euros per liter all taxes included, i.e. a price unit per bottle of 50 milliliters maximum of 2 euros all taxes included; (2) for containers with a volume greater than 50 milliliters and less than or equal to 100 milliliters, 30 euros all taxes included per liter, ie a maximum unit price per bottle of 100 milliliters of 3 euros all taxes included; (3) for containers with a volume greater than 100 milliliters and less than or equal to 300 milliliters, 16 euros and 70 centimes all taxes included per liter, i.e. a maximum unit price per bottle of 300 milliliters of 5 euros all taxes included; (4) for containers with a volume greater than 300 milliliters, 28 euros all taxes included per liter, i.e. a maximum unit price per bottle of 500 milliliters of 14 euros all taxes included. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 4 because Monaco changed the forecast prices of hydro-alcoholic products.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective April 7 and until August 31, Monaco decided that the occupational physicians of the Office of Occupational Medicine (Office de la médecine du travail) can set up a remote consultation by means of information and communication technologies to carry out individual monitoring of the state of health of any employee, civil servant, agent of the State or of the Municipality, subject to respecting the following conditions: (1) the employee, the civil servant, the agent of the State or the Municipality accepts the teleconsultation; (2) the communication system used allows real-time communication and guarantees the confidentiality and traceability of exchanges. At the end of the remote consultation, the doctor can: (1) establish any prescription necessary within the framework of the individual monitoring of the state of health of the employee, the civil servant, the State official or the Common; (2) decide on the suitability of the employee, the civil servant, the agent of the State or of the Municipality; (3) if he considers it necessary, summon the employee, the civil servant, the agent of the State or of the Municipality to the premises of the Office of Occupational Medicine to carry out the medical examination in his presence.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 14 and until May 31, Monaco decided that the price of surgical masks cannot exceed 2.50 euros (all taxes includes) the unit, and the price of FFP2 masks cannot exceed 7.50 euros (all taxes includes) the unit. Any breach is punishable of a fine from 75 to 200 euros. UPDATE: Effective May 12 and until further notice, Monaco decided that the price of surgical masks cannot exceed 1.50 euros (all taxes includes) the unit, and the price of FFP2 masks cannot exceed 6.50 euros (all taxes includes) the unit.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 14 and until July 31, Monaco decided that capillary blood samples intended to enable COVID-19 detection examinations and the reading of rapid serological tests for said virus may be carried out, under the responsibility of a doctor, by: (1) rescuers from the Monegasque Red Cross and soldiers from the Force Publique, holders of the “first aid in level 1 team” teaching unit; (2) employees and volunteers, non-health professionals, working in a prevention structure or an associative structure involved in health prevention (on condition that this structure has the authorization subordinate to the signing of an agreement allowing a structure prevention or an associative structure involved in health prevention to practice rapid diagnostic orientation tests for HIV infection 1 and 2 concluded with the Director of Health and Social Action) provided that he has previously followed training in the use of rapid diagnostic orientation tests for HIV infection 1 and 2.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 29 and until August 31, Monaco decided that in the event of difficulty in the supply of midazolam, pharmaceutical specialties based on clonazepam may be prescribed outside the framework of their marketing authorizations by any doctor, even a non-specialist, for the taking in drug load of anxiety and sedation situations for palliative practices, in compliance with the recommendations of the French High Authority for Health.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 29 and until August 31, Monaco decided that the pharmaceutical specialty PLAQUENIL ©, in accordance with the indications of its marketing authorization, and preparations based on hydroxychloroquine can only be dispensed by pharmacies within the framework of an initial prescription issued exclusively from specialists in rheumatology, internal medicine, dermatology, nephrology, neurology or pediatrics or in the context of a prescription renewal from any doctor.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 27 and until further notice, Monaco decided that hydroxychloroquine and the lopinavir/ritonavir combination can be prescribed, dispensed and administered, under the responsibility of a physician, to patients affected by COVID-19 in the health establishments that treat them, as well as, for the continuation of their treatment if their condition allows it and with the authorization of the initial prescriber, at home. These prescriptions come into effect, after collegial decision, in compliance with the recommendations of the French High Council for Public Health and, in particular, the indication for patients with oxygen-requiring pneumonia or organ failure. UPDATE: On May 29, the Monegasque government repealed the ministerial decision that established this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Delivery cannot be guaranteed for a period exceeding one month and it is renewable until April 15, 2020. That policy does not concern theses treatments: drugs containing substances with hypnotic or anxiolytic properties; opioid substitution therapy with methadone in the form of capsules, methadone in the form of syrup or buprenorphine tablets; narcotic drugs or drugs falling under the drug regime.

description: Effective April 6 and until May 31, Monaco decided that the pharmaceutical specialty based on belatacept can be dispensed to the public by the pharmacy for internal use of the Princess Grace Hospital Center to guarantee maintenance treatments for graft rejection in adult patients who have received a renal transplant. The pharmacy for internal use delivers, on the basis of the hospital prescription, the pharmaceutical specialty mentioned in the first paragraph and provides a protocol for the administration of the treatment as well as the other medical prescriptions necessary for the care of the patient at his home. Based on the medical prescription, the administration of the pharmaceutical specialty is carried out by a nurse at the patient's home in accordance with the treatment administration protocol provided by the pharmacy for internal use. UPDATE: On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 1 and until May 31, Monaco decided that when the period of validity of a prescription prescribing nursing care has expired, the nurse may continue (under the conditions provided for by the initial prescription) the following care: nursing care related to a long-term illness, including treatment prolonged and particularly expensive therapy, which appears on the list provided for in article 2 of ministerial decree n° 94-365; nursing care in connection with a serious serious condition not appearing on the said list or several conditions leading to an invalidating pathological state, provided that the patient is recognized as having it by the social security body to which he is responsible and that this or these conditions require prolonged treatment and particularly expensive therapy; nursing care requiring the prescription of medical devices provided for by I of article 1 of ministerial decree n° 2007-647; monitoring of drug intake for patients with psychiatric disorders and cognitive disorders; home nursing care for a dependent patient; the sample as part of the prescription of a surveillance biology examination of a chronic pathology. UPDATE: On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective April 14 and until May 31, Monaco decided that only surgical masks bearing the CE marking and whose labeling includes the indications provided for in point 13.3 of appendix I of ministerial decree n ° 2003-581 of 10 November 2003 may be sold under the name of surgical masks. In addition, only those FFP2 masks bearing the CE marking and accompanied by the required documents and the instructions and information provided for in point 1.4 of Annex II of Regulation (EU) 2016/425 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 9 March 2016 on personal protective equipment may be sold under the name of FFP2 masks. Any breach is punishable of a fine from 75 to 200 euros. UPDATE: On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Any breach is punishable of a fine from 75 to 200 euros. UPDATE: On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.

description: On March 24, Monaco decided that until May 31, the dispensing by pharmacies of drugs or other products composed exclusively of paracetamol is, in the absence of a prescription, limited to two boxes for people claiming to have symptoms such as fever or pain and one box for people claiming to have other symptoms or none symptom. UPDATE: On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: On March 24, Monaco decided that until May 31, the dispensing by pharmacies for internal use of any specialty consisting of hydroxychloroquine, such as Plaquenil, or chloroquine, such as Nivaquine, is prohibited, apart from clinical trials, when this medicinal product has been prescribed either in a dosage which does not comply with its marketing authorization, or in combination with any medicinal product composed of azithromycin, such as Zithromax. UPDATE: On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective April 17 and until May 31, Monaco decided that when supply difficulties in in vitro diagnostic medical devices prevent medical biology laboratories from carrying out examinations to detect the SARS-CoV-2 genome by RT PCR in sufficient numbers to cope with the health crisis, they may use in vitro diagnostic medical devices that do not have a CE marking when the following conditions are met: (1) the in vitro diagnostic medical device meets harmonized standards or the technical specifications of the European Union, it complies with the validation procedure of the French national reference center “Respiratory infection viruses (including influenza)” and is validated by this center before it is put into service; (2) the laboratory manager informs this center before using these devices for the first time and keeps the relevant technical documentation at his disposal. UPDATE: On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective March 31 and until April 15, Monaco decided that the pharmaceutical specialty Rivotril® in injectable form can be dispensed by dispensing pharmacies for the treatment of patients affected or likely to be affected by the COVID-19 whose clinical condition warrants it upon presentation of a medical prescription bearing the words “Prescription Outside Marketing Authorization in the context of COVID-19”. UPDATE: This policy was first extended until May 31. On May 27, Monaco decided that it will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective April 3 and until May 31, Monaco decided that hydro-alcoholic solutions intended for human hygiene can be prepared, in the event of a failure in their supply and subject to having suitable premises, by dispensing pharmacies and pharmacies for internal use. These hydro-alcoholic solutions are prepared under the conditions recommended by the World Health Organization. UPDATE: On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since March 31, Monaco decided that the dispensing pharmacist may renew, within the framework of the initially planned dosage, the delivery of drugs containing substances with hypnotic or anxiolytic properties, provided that these drugs have been dispensed to the patient for at least three consecutive months. This issue cannot be guaranteed for a period exceeding 28 days. Effective June 2 and until August 31, Monaco specified that this kind of prescription renewal is only allowed when the patient is unable to meet their doctor.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since March 31, Monaco decided that in the case of opioid substitution treatment of at least three months based on methadone in the form of capsules, of methadone in the form of syrup or of buprenorphine tablets, when the period of validity of the last prescription has expired, the dispensary pharmacist whose dispensary is mentioned on the prescription may, after agreement of the prescribing physician, dispense, within the framework of the dosage and the initial fractionation procedures defined by this doctor, a number of boxes per prescription line guaranteeing continuation of treatment. The delivery can be ensured for a period not exceeding 28 days, including for methadone in the form of syrup. Effective June 2 and until August 31, Monaco specified that this kind of prescription renewal is only allowed when the patient is unable to meet their doctor.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since March 31, Monaco decided that within the framework of the care of the patient treated by narcotic drugs or coming under the narcotics regime, when the period of validity of the last prescription has expired, the dispensing pharmacist and the pharmacist managing the pharmacy of the Center Hospitalier Princesse Grace, having previously dispensed these drugs to the patient, may, with the written consent of the prescribing physician, dispense, within the framework of the dosage and the terms of fractionation initially defined by this doctor, a number of boxes per prescription line guaranteeing the continuation of treatment. This doctor may supplement the written agreement mentioned in the previous paragraph with a new prescription meeting regulatory requirements, if he considers it necessary to adjust the dosage. Delivery may be insured for a period not exceeding 28 days. Effective June 2 and until August 31, Monaco specified that this kind of prescription renewal is only allowed when the patient is unable to meet their doctor.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since March 31, as part of chronic treatment, Monaco decided that when the period of validity of a renewable prescription has expired, the pharmacist dispensary and pharmacists in the pharmacy for internal use of the Princess Grace Hospital Center can deliver, within the framework of the initially planned dosage, a number of boxes per prescription line guaranteeing the continuation of treatment. Delivery cannot be guaranteed for a period exceeding one month. That policy does not concern theses treatments: drugs containing substances with hypnotic or anxiolytic properties; opioid substitution therapy with methadone in the form of capsules, methadone in the form of syrup or buprenorphine tablets; narcotic drugs or drugs falling under the drug regime. Effective June 2 and until August 31, Monaco specified that this kind of prescription renewal is only allowed when the patient is unable to meet their doctor.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Specifically, (1) health professionals who are authorised to carry out vaccinations will initially only do so for (2) Monegasque patients or (3) residents over 65 years of age who have a certificate issued by the social security funds, and for healthcare workers.
