description: Effective May 4 and until further notice, Monaco decided that wearing a mask is mandatory in urban public transport, taxis and vehicles with large discounts. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since March 18, all the projects under the control of public works (Maîtrise d’Ouvrage Publique), whether direct or delegated, were closed (except the site of the United States quay). On April 1, Monaco decided to reopen the sites of Larvotto and the Casino square. The following measures will be adopted: temperature measurement at the site entrance; equipment in gloves, masks and gel compulsory; restrictive arrangement of cantonments; lunches on site with respect for distances; enhanced hygiene of equipment and vehicles. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 4. Public construction can resume under conditions.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Other government service not specified above
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: Effective April 10 and until May 3, Monaco asks its residents to keep at least 1,5 meter between them if they come from different houses. Any regrouping, even fortuitous, of people not confined in the same residence is prohibited. A first offence is punishable by a fine from 75 to 200 euros. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is from 200 to 600 euros. UPDATE: On April 28, Monaco announced that this policy will finally stay in place until further notice.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective June 7 and until further notice, the Monaco CHPG authorizes families to visit their relatives in the residences for the eldery (CRIII, Cap Fleuri, A Qietüdine), up to 3 times a week. Visits duration cannot be more than 1 hour. Only one person by family is authorized. An appointment is mandatory. The wearing of a mask is mandatory for all of those aged of 5 years old and over. Failure to comply with this obligation results in a fine. The amount is of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People in nursing homes/long term care facilities,Other population not specifed above

description: Effective May 11 and until May 17, Monaco decided that in high school (lycée) and higher education, only those who are in these classes are allowed to be in school: 1st, Terminale and BTS. Parents of affected students can choose not to send their children to school. The canteen will remain closed and sports lessons will be suspended. Every students must keep a distance of 1,5 meter in school. Wearing a mask is mandatory for students and teachers. Classes open face-to-face operate in half-groups.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: Effective May 11 and until May 25, the Monaco CHPG authorizes the resumption of visits to residences for the elderly in Monaco (CRIII, Cap Fleuri, A Qietüdine). Visits will only be authorized for relatives, once a week after making an appointment. The visit will take place in the room between 2 p.m. and 6 p.m. and should not last more than an hour. Families should not come in case of fever, cough or contact with an affected person. Visitors will wear a mask, have a hydro-alcoholic solution at their disposal and will use a dedicated elevator before going to the resident's room (with a few exceptions, especially if there is a double room).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities

description: Effective March 13 and until further notice, Monaco (via the Department of Social Affairs) decided to ban visits to residences for the elderly (A Qietüdine, Cap Fleuri and Denis Ravera Care Uniti of Rainier-III Center). However, patients in the follow-up and rehabilitation unit as well as patients in the acute geriatrics unit can receive one visit per day. External speakers in the field of animation are no longer allowed either. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 11. Visits are now autorized under conditions.

description: Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco decided that access to natural or man-made beaches is authorized between 6 a.m. and 9 p.m., subject to permanent compliance with health distancing rules. Only their dynamic use for individual sports practice is authorized. Picnics as well as the practice of team sports are prohibited there. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Beaches
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco decided that any user or client hosted or received in an establishment, whether public or private and, by reciprocity, any person welcoming or receiving a user or a client outside his establishment, are required to wear a mask. The wearing mask by children under five is not required. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside All government services regulated

description: Since May 4, Monaco has decided that food stores must follow these measures: (1) hydro-alcoholic product at the entrances and in the toilets; (2) mark an entrance and an exit with signage, when possible; (3) materialize traffic flows with signage when possible; (4) indicate at the entrance a reminder of the barrier gestures and the maximum number of authorized customers, on the basis of one person per 4 m²; (5) provide a dedicated agent to manage the flows of companies with an area greater than 700 m²; (6) clean and disinfect electronic payment terminals after each use and all items touched by customers; (7) staff have sufficient masks and hand rubs and wash their hands frequently; (8) install a transparent protective screen or, if not possible, equip staff with a visor for all activities with customers; (10) favor payment by credit card; (11) strengthen the cleaning and disinfection of premises and equipment; (12) favor shelving outside the establishment's opening hours; (13) where possible, assign individual work tools; (14) set up a time slot at the opening for people over 65, pregnant women and people with disabilities. As of May 14 and until further notice, Monaco has clarified the obligation regarding masks: all those aged 5 years and over must wear a mask inside and in the queues at the outside. A breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2nd time and 1000-2250 € if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Supermarkets/grocery stores

description: Since May 4, Monaco decided that all stores and shopping centers can reopen. General measures they have to follow: (1) ensure that customers wear a mask; (2) provide hydro-alcoholic product at entrances, in toilets, dressing rooms, changing rooms; (3) mark out an entrance and an exit with signage, when possible; (4) signage traffic flows; (5) indicate at the entrance a reminder of the barrier gestures and the maximum number of customers authorized (with a basis of one person/4 m²); (6) provide a dedicated agent for businesses with an area greater than 700 m² to manage the flow; (7) clean and disinfect electronic payment terminals after each use and all items touched by customers; (8) equip the staff with masks, hydro-alcoholic products and provide frequent hand washing and disinfection; (9) set up a transparent protective screen or, if impossible, equip the staff with a visor for all activities with customers; (10) favor payment by credit card; (11) strengthen the cleaning and disinfection of premises and equipment; (12) favor shelving outside the establishment's opening hours; (13) it possible, assign individual work tools. A distance of 1,5 m between each other is mandatory. Failure by an establishment may justify its closure. Effective May 14 and until further notice, children under 5 do not have to wear maks. A breach is now punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1rst time, 200-600 € the 2d time and 1000-2250 € if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.

description: Effective May 5 and until further notice, Monaco decided to open its courthouse to the public, from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.. Access will be limited to the reception hall and courtrooms. Lawyers will be able to access the room reserved for them, limited to four people. Measures to be observed: wash your hands very regularly; use hydro-alcoholic gel; wearing a mask is strongly recommended; greet without shaking hands and avoid hugs; keep a distance of at least 1.50 m from any other person; cough or sneeze into your elbow or into a disposable tissue; use disposable tissues. Upon entering the building, two separate circuits were set up, one for legal professionals and the other for the public. Hygiaphones have been installed in reception stations, and regular cleaning will be carried out. The exchanges between lawyers and the court will, in the long term, mainly be dematerialized. The filing of cases on the day of the hearing will be the rule and the pleadings will be postponed to subsequent hearings after the next judicial reopening. Staff in contact with the public will be provided with masks and gloves. All hearings will be gradually restored to be fully from the last week of May. Hearings in the presence of the parties will be limited to criminal matters to those where the presence of persons is mandatory or in the event of non-representation by a lawyer.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Public courts
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice

description: Since May 4 and until further notice, Monaco decided that wearing a mask is mandatory in urban public transport, taxis and vehicles with large discounts. Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco precised that children under 5 years old are not concerned by this measure. Monaco also adds that wearing a mask is compulsory on trains, as well as on the platforms and galleries of the train station. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco decided that general preventive and hygienic measures intended to limit the spread of the COVID-19 must be observed by healthcare professionals. Wearing a mask is compulsory for patients going to a health professional. Wearing a mask by children under five years old is not required. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 4 and until further notice, fashion and ready-to-wear stores can reopen their doors to the public. However, these establishments are required to comply with the general measures (see the other entry) and measures specific to their activity. The non-recognition of these measures by an establishment may justify its closure. Specific measures concerning fashion and ready-to-wear stores: (1) plan to use only one fitting room in two; (2) when trying on clothes to put on over the head (dress, t-shirt, etc.), it is necessary to (a) provide the customer with a square of fabric large enough to cover the entire face, which must be thrown or changed between each customer, placed in a resealable bag and washed at 60 ° C, and (b) to proceed with a high temperature steam anti-crease on the clothes after they have been tried on and for any item returned for exchange. UPDATE: Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco decided to implement a fine in case of an offense. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses

description: Effective May 4 and until further notice, Monaco decided that all shopping centers can reopen. Shopping centers must comply with the general measures (see the other entry) and measures specific to their activity. Failure by an establishment may justify its closure. Specific measures: (1) provide hydro-alcoholic product at entrances and in the toilets and continuously supply soap dispensers; (2) mark out an entrance and an exit; (3) signage traffic flows; (4) indicate at the entrance a reminder of the barrier gestures and the maximum number of authorized customers, taking as a base one for 12 m², staff included (to do this: organize queues at the entrance of the shops with a 1.5 m spacing between customers and set up a system for counting flows at entrances and exits); (5) equip security personnel with masks, hydro-alcoholic products and tweezers in the event that disposable masks are distributed to customers; (6) use video surveillance to detect, treat and remove high density areas; (7) adapt the use of benches to respect a distance of 1.5 m between two seats; (8) increase the disinfection of the areas most often affected; (9) increase the quantity of fresh air injected and perform “free cooling” regularly during opening hours while limiting appliance condensation; (10) Establish and disseminate a protocol for take-out sales and the delivery service of catering outlets; (11) set up a protocol for the security personnel to take charge of a person presenting symptoms. UPDATE: Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco decided to implement a fine in case of an offense. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 4 and until further notice, Hairdressers, beauty salons and nail bars are allowed to reopen their doors to the public. However, these establishments are required to comply with the general measures (see the other entry) and measures specific to their activity. The non-recognition of these measures by an establishment may justify its closure. Specific measures concerning hairdressing salons, beauty institutes and nail bars: (1) ensure a distance of 1.5 m between workstations; (2) welcome clients only by appointment with sufficient margin to avoid waiting; (3) provide staff and customers with alcohol-based hand rubs at each workstation; (4) systematically change the work instruments between each client and soak the instruments previously used in a disinfectant solution; (5) clean and disinfect objects, surfaces and work equipment that may have been contaminated; (6) change disposable single-use (bathrobe, headband, towel, etc.) or washable linen between each client and placed without delay after use in a dedicated resealable bag; (7) use single-use and disposable razors; (8) provide for the installation of a transparent protective screen or the wearing of a mask and visor; (9) not to offer magazines or digital tablets; (10) not offer food or drink to customers. UPDATE: Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco decided to implement a fine in case of an offense. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Personal Grooming Businesses (e.g. hair salons)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 4 and until further notice, Monaco decided that food stores must follow these measure: (1) mask is mandatory for everyone; (2) provide a dispenser of hydro-alcoholic product at entrances to the store, in the toilets, dressing rooms and changing rooms; (3) mark out an entrance and an exit with signage, in businesses that have at least two entrances or an entrance with sufficient width; (4) materialize with signage, whenever possible, traffic flows; (5) indicate at the entrance a reminder of the barrier gestures and the maximum number of customers authorized in the shop, taking as a basis one person for 4 m²; (6) provide a dedicated agent for businesses with an area greater than 700 m² in order to manage the flow; (7) clean and disinfect electronic payment terminals after each use and all items touched by customers; (8) equip the staff with masks, hydro-alcoholic products and provide frequent hand washing with soap and disinfection; (9) set up a transparent protective screen or, if impossible, equip the staff with a visor for operations during collections or all activities with customers; (10) favor payment by credit card; (11) strengthen the cleaning and disinfection of premises and equipment; (12) favor shelving outside the establishment's opening hours; (13) as far as possible assign individual work tools; (14) set up a time slot at the opening for people over 65, pregnant women and people with disabilities. Failure by an establishment may justify its closure. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 14, because Monaco specified who has to wear a mask.

description: Effective May 5 and until further notice, Monaco decided to open its courthouse to the public, from 2 p.m. at 16 o'clock. Access will be limited to the reception hall and courtrooms. Lawyers will be able to access the room reserved for them, limited to four people. Measures to be observed: wash your hands very regularly; use hydro-alcoholic gel; wearing a mask is strongly recommended; greet without shaking hands and avoid hugs; keep a distance of at least 1.50 m from any other person; cough or sneeze into your elbow or into a disposable tissue; use disposable tissues. Upon entering the building, two separate circuits were set up, one for legal professionals and the other for the public. Hygiaphones have been installed in reception stations, and regular cleaning will be carried out. The exchanges between lawyers and the court will, in the long term, mainly be dematerialized. The filing of cases on the day of the hearing will be the rule and the pleadings will be postponed to subsequent hearings after the next judicial reopening. Staff in contact with the public will be provided with masks and gloves. All hearings will be gradually restored to be fully from the last week of May. Hearings in the presence of the parties will be limited to criminal matters to those where the presence of persons is mandatory or in the event of non-representation by a lawyer. UPDATE: Monaco decided that wearing a mask is mandatory for everyone of 5 years old or over. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Public courts
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice

description: Effective April 10 and until May 3, Monaco asks its residents to keep at least 1,5 meter between them if they come from different houses. Any regrouping, even fortuitous, of people not confined in the same residence is prohibited. A first offence is punishable by a fine from 75 to 200 euros. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is from 200 to 600 euros. UPDATE: On April 28, Monaco announced that this policy will finally stay in place until further notice. Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco increased the fine. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Effective May 4 and until further notice, Monaco decided that wearing a mask is mandatory in urban public transport, taxis and vehicles with large discounts. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. UPDATE: This policy ends on May 14, because Monaco specified who has to wear a mask.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective May 11 and until May 25, the Monaco CHPG authorizes the resumption of visits to residences for the elderly in Monaco (CRIII, Cap Fleuri, A Qietüdine). Visits will only be authorized for relatives, once a week after making an appointment. The visit will take place in the room between 2 p.m. and 6 p.m. and should not last more than an hour. Families should not come in case of fever, cough or contact with an affected person. Visitors will wear a mask, have a hydro-alcoholic solution at their disposal and will use a dedicated elevator before going to the resident's room (with a few exceptions, especially if there is a double room). UPDATE: Effective May 14 and until further, failure to comply with the obligation of wearing a mask results in a fine. The amount is of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People in nursing homes/long term care facilities,Other population not specifed above

description: Effective May 18 and until May 24, Monaco decided that in college, high school (lycée) and the higher education system, only those who are in these classes are allowed to attend school in person: AIS (college), 6th, 3rd, 1st, Terminal and BTS. Parents of affected students can choose not to send their children to school. The canteen will remain closed and sports lessons will be suspended. Reinforced aseptic measures will be implemented. Every students must keep a distance of 1,5 meter in school. Wearing a mask is mandatory for students and teachers. Classes open face-to-face operate in half-groups.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: Since May 14, Monaco decided that access to natural or man-made beaches is authorized between 6 a.m. and 9 p.m. The practice of team sports is prohibited. Effective May 20 and until further notice, Monaco specified that the distance of at least 1.50 m between people applies, with the exception of members of the same household. Groups are limited to a family or a group of up to 5 people. Wearing a mask is not compulsory subject to strict compliance with sanitary distancing, with the exception of members of the same household. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Beaches
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since May 4, Monaco has decided that all administrative establishments called upon to welcome the public are reopenning their doors to the public. Effective May 20 and until further notice, they have to follow these measures: (1) wearing a mask for all individuals aged 5 and over (2) dispensers of alcohol-based handrub are placed at all entrances, in the toilets and where necessary; (3) staff have masks, hydro-alcoholic products and frequently wash their hands with soap and disinfect them; (4) a reminder of the barrier gestures and the maximum number of persons authorized simultaneously in a place, staff included are indicated at the entrance; (5) a distance of 1.50 m between people is respected in all places and materialized on the ground, in particular for the queues; (6) a direction of movement is materialized by appropriate signage; (7) cleaning and disinfection of premises and equipment are reinforced; (8) ventilation systems are in perfect condition; (9) strict compliance with the cleaning and disinfection instructions indicated on the products used; (10) dry disinfectant welcome mats are installed where the floor is carpeted; (11) the personnel have products suitable for the cleaning and disinfection operations; (12) payment by credit card is preferred; (13) the premises are ventilated as soon as possible. A breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2nd time and 1000-2250 € if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other public facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

Hydroalcoholic gel dispensers must be installed and all must respect a sanitary distance of 1.50 m. Regular asepsis of the places of passage and contact will be carried out. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 20, because Monaco changed the conditions in which the administrative establishments are autorized to open.

description: Effective May 14 and until further notice, Monaco decided that access to natural or man-made beaches is authorized between 6 a.m. and 9 p.m., subject to permanent compliance with health distancing rules. Only their dynamic use for individual sports practice is authorized. Picnics as well as the practice of team sports are prohibited there. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros. UPDATE: The policy ends on May 20, because Monaco changed some rules regarding what is forbidden to do on beaches.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Effective May 25 and until the end of the scholar year, Monaco decided that in primary schools, college, high schools (lycée) and higher education system, only those who study in these classes are allowed to attend school in person: AIS (college and primary school), CP, CM2, 6th, 3rd, 1st, Terminal and BTS. Parents of affected students can choose not to send their children to school. The canteen will remain closed and sports lessons will be suspended. Reinforced aseptic measures will be implemented. Every students must keep a distance of 1,5 meter in school. Wearing a mask is mandatory for students and teachers. Classes open face-to-face and operate in half-groups.

Visitors will wear a mask, have a hydro-alcoholic solution at their disposal and will use a dedicated elevator before going to the resident's room (with a few exceptions, especially if there is a double room). description: Since February 27, Monaco recommends to its residents to avoid too close contact and moving around if it is not necessary, to wash their hands regularly with soap and water or with an alcohol-based solution, to cough or sneez in their elbow or use a disposable tissue. However, one should only wear a mask if he doubts he has contrated the COVID-19. On march 12, Monaco specified its recomendation regarding the distance people should keep between each other. Monaco asked to keep 1 meter of distance between each other. UPDATE: This policy is mandatory since March 18 and was firstly made to last until March 31. Monaco first extended it until May 31. On May 27, Monaco decided that this policy will finally end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective June 2 and until further notice, Monaco decided that museums and exhibition halls may reopen. Measures to respect: (1) wearing a mask for all those aged 5 and over; (2) hydro-alcoholic product are placed at all entrances, in toilets and where it is necessary; (3) staff always have sufficient masks and hydro-alcoholic products available and frequently wash their hands; (4) a reminder of the barrier gestures and the maximum number of people allowed are indicated at the entrance; (5) distance of 1.50 m between people, materialized on the ground, in particular for the queues; (6) a direction of circulation with an entrance and an exit is materialized by signage when possible; (7) the cleaning and disinfection of premises and equipment are stepped up; (8) the ventilation, fresh air supply and air conditioning / heating systems are maintained in perfect condition; (9) strict compliance with the cleaning and disinfection instructions indicated on the products used; (10) dry disinfectant welcome mats are installed in all places where the floor is carpeted; (11) the staff always have products adapted to the cleaning and disinfection operations required within the framework of their activity; (12) payment by credit card is preferred; (13) premises are ventilated regularly. Any failure is punishable by a fine of 75-200 euros. For a second offense, the fine is 200-600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than 3 times within 30 working days, the fine is 1000-2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Public museums/galleries
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective June 2 and until further notice, Monaco decided that gaming rooms and slot machines may reopen. Measures to respect: (1) thorough cleaning before reopening (in particular washing carpets); (2) dry disinfectant welcome mats; (3) maximum number of people authorized is 1/4 m²; (4) hand disinfection at each start / finish at gaming tables and slot machines; (5) croupiers have protective visors when they are close to customers; (6) separate slot machines by 1.50 m or install separation elements; (7) install separation screens between players around the same table; (8) clean once a day and disinfect several times a day of play equipment; (9) wearing a mask; (10) hydro-alcoholic product at entrances, toilets and where necessary; (11) the staff have enough masks and hydro-alcoholic products and frequently wash their hands; (12) a reminder of barrier gestures and the maximum number of persons is at the entrance; (13) 1.50 m of distance is respected and materialized on the ground; (14) direction of circulation is materialized when possible; (15) cleaning and disinfection are reinforced; (16) ventilation is in perfect condition; (17) follow the cleaning and disinfection instructions of products used; (18) products suitable to clean and disinfect; (19) payment by credit card preferred; (20) ventilating frequently. Any breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 euros the first time, 200-600 euros the second time and 1000-2250 euros if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Effective June 2 and until further notice, Monaco decided that open-air cinemas are allowed to open again to the public. Measures to respect: (1) hydroalcoolique products at disposition; (2) install a direction of circulation to prevent people from crossing each other; (3)  wearing a mask is mandatory; (4) limit the number of spectator to respect a distance of 1,5 m between everyone; (5) adapt the placing in order to respect a distance of 1,5 m between families and couples; (6) clean and disinfect, after each representation, everything that could have been in contact with a spectator.

description: Effective June 2 and until further notice, Monaco decided that swimming pools can reopen, but only to sports practitioners. Measures to respect: (1) snacks and hydration are managed individually; (2) no sharing of personal effects; (3) favorize personal equipment (common equipment is cleaned between each use); (4) no more than 5 people for organized gatherings; (5) set up a transparent protective screen or, if impossible, equip staff with a visor for activities with customers; (6) distance benches by 1.50 m; (7) increase the volume of fresh air supply to at least 80% without reducing it at night and degrease and disinfect the ventilation systems and change the filters; (8) maintain an active chlorine rate of 0.8 to 1.4 mg / L in the ponds and maintain the footbaths at the chlorination rate of 3 to 4 mg / L; (9) limit to 1 person/4m² of surface area open to the public; (10) limit the number of people in the changing rooms to 1 person/4m2; (11) distance of 1.50 m between users; (12) bathers' behavioral rules are respected and encourage hand washing when entering and leaving changing rooms; (13) condemn one in two showers if shared showers; (14) no hair dryers; (15) always use swimming lines; (16) no groups of more than 2 people on beaches around pools. Sports halls, saunas, hammams and jacuzzis are closed. Any breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 euros the first time, 200-600 euros the second time and 1000-2250 euros if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other public facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From June 2 and until further notice, Monaco decided that bars and restaurants can reopen. Measures to follow: (1) in restaurants, only by reservation; (2) a mask when clients aged 5 and over are not seated; (3) no more than 4 clients/table, or 6 if possible, and 50 cm between clients; (4) separate tables by 1,50 m or install separation elements; (5) favor the terrace; (6) no counter service (seating at a table is mandatory); (7) no cloakroom service; (8) menus on smartphones or plastic cards cleaned between clients; (9) clean tables between use (disinfect tables, chairs, protective screens, table accessories); (10) no buffets or plates to share; (11) limit the music; (12) no karaoke or activities generating proximity and use of common equipment; (13) hydro-alcoholic product where necessary; (14) staff have enough masks and hydro-alcoholic products and wash their hands frequently; (15) at the entrance, a reminder of barrier gestures and the maximum number of people; (16) direction of circulation materialized; (17) ventilation in perfect condition; (18) follow cleaning and disinfection instructions; (19) dry disinfectant mats where there is carpet; (20) enough products to clean and disinfect; (21) payment by credit card preferred; (22) ventilate regularly. No activities of discotheque, piano bar, entertainment, events or live music. A breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2d time and 1000-2250 € if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective June 2 and until further notice, Monaco decided that congresses and open-air cultural activities are authorized. Measures to respect: (1) maximum number of people inside is 1/4 m²; (2) transparent protective screen or equip staff with a visor for activities with customers; (3) enhance dematerialized tickets; (4) provide disposable equipment to visitors and use applications on smartphones for guided tours; (5) presence of an agent in front of attraction points; (6) limit free entertainment and screening rooms; (8) wearing a mask for all those aged 5 and over; (9) hydro-alcoholic product at entrances, toilets and where necessary; (10) staff have sufficient masks and hydro-alcoholic products and frequently wash their hands; (11) a reminder of barrier gestures and the maximum number of persons is at the entrance; (12) 1.50 m of distance is respected and materialized on the ground; (13) a direction of circulation is materialized where possible; (14) cleaning and disinfection is reinforced; (15) ventilation is in perfect condition; (16) compliance with the cleaning and disinfection instructions; (17) dry disinfectant welcome mats where the floor is carpeted; (18) products adapted to the cleaning and disinfection operations; (19) payment by credit card is preferred; (20) ventilate frequently. Any breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 euros the first time, 200-600 euros the second time and 1000-2250 euros if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.

description: Since May 4, Monaco decided that fashion and ready-to-wear stores can reopen their doors to the public. Effective June 4 and until further notice, the have to follow these measures: (1) use only one cabin in two; (2) when trying on clothes to put on over the head, provide the customer with a square of disposable fabric large enough to cover the entire face, which must be or changed between each customer, placed in a resealable bag and washed at 60 ° C; (3) perform high temperature steam smoothing of pull-on garments after testing and any item returned for exchange or storage in an isolated area for 48 hours; (4) steam the curtains of the test booths at least twice a day. These establishments are also required to comply with the general measures for stores (see the other entry). Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros. The non-recognition of these measures by an establishment may justify its closure.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Effective May 4 and until further notice, fashion and ready-to-wear stores can reopen their doors to the public. However, these establishments are required to comply with the general measures (see the other entry) and measures specific to their activity. The non-recognition of these measures by an establishment may justify its closure. Specific measures concerning fashion and ready-to-wear stores: (1) plan to use only one fitting room in two; (2) when trying on clothes to put on over the head (dress, t-shirt, etc.), it is necessary to (a) provide the customer with a square of fabric large enough to cover the entire face, which must be thrown or changed between each customer, placed in a resealable bag and washed at 60 ° C, and (b) to proceed with a high temperature steam anti-crease on the clothes after they have been tried on and for any item returned for exchange. UPDATE: The policy ends on June 4, because Monaco changed the conditions in which these establishments can open.

description: From June 6 and until further notice, Monaco decided that swimming pools can open. Measures:  the manager has validated by the Director of Sanitary Action his sanitary protocol (in particular the cleaning and disinfection plan) (not required for pools open only to sports practitioners); (1) increase fresh air intake to at least 80%, degrease and disinfect the ventilation and change filters; (2) chlorine rate of 0.8 to 1.4 mg/L in ponds and of 3 to 4 mg/L in footbaths; (3) entry traceability system; (4) nobody with respiratory or digestive signs; (5) 1.50 m between users; (6) remind users the behavioral rules; (7) 1 person/4 m² of public surface area (excluding hall, changing rooms, showers, toilets); (5) no groups of more than 2 around pools; (6) 1 user/2 m² in indoor pools, 3 users/2 m² in outdoor pools; (7) footbath and shower before entering; (8) using diving boards and slides only if there is supervision, reinforced disinfection, 1 user at a time, immediate evacuation, a queue respecting distances; (9) no paddling pools; (10) 1 user/4 m² in collective changing rooms; (11) limit the lockers to the number of users, spaced by 1.50 m; (12) soap with automatic dispensers in showers; (13) condemn 1 in 2 showers; (14) no hair dryers; (15) no saunas, hammams, baths or whirlpools; (16) mask for all of those aged of 5 and over. A breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2nd time and 1000-2250 € if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.

description: From June 6 and until further notice, Monaco decided that swimming pools can open. Measures:  the manager has validated by the Director of Sanitary Action his sanitary protocol (in particular the cleaning and disinfection plan) (not required for pools open only to sports practitioners); (1) increase fresh air intake to at least 80%, degrease and disinfect the ventilation and change filters; (2) chlorine rate of 0.8 to 1.4 mg/L in ponds and of 3 to 4 mg/L in footbaths; (3) entry traceability system; (4) nobody with respiratory or digestive signs; (5) 1.50 m between users; (6) remind users the behavioral rules; (7) 1 person/4 m² of public surface area (excluding hall, changing rooms, showers, toilets); (5) no groups of more than 2 around pools; (6) 1 user/2 m² in indoor pools, 3 users/2 m² in outdoor pools; (7) footbath and shower before entering; (8) using diving boards and slides only if there is supervision, reinforced disinfection, 1 user at a time, immediate evacuation, a queue respecting distances; (9) no paddling pools; (10) 1 user/4 m² in collective changing rooms; (11) limit the lockers to the number of users, spaced by 1.50 m; (12) soap with automatic dispensers in showers; (13) condemn 1 in 2 showers; (14) no hair dryers; (15) no saunas, hammams, baths or whirlpools; (16) mask for all of those aged of 5 and over. A breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2nd time and 1000-2250 € if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Other government service not specified above
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective June 6 and until further notice, Monaco decided that children's playground can now open under conditions: (1) before reopening, carry out a defoaming of the soft floors (brushing with a soft brush of the surfaces covered with foam; sweeping of all the surfaces; pressure cleaning with anti-foam additive of all the surfaces); (2) disinfect play structures and contact points at least once a day; (3) wash the soil structures every day when closing with high pressure equipment associated with a disinfectant followed by effective rinsing; (4) adapt the use of the benches so as to respect a sanitary distance of at least one meter fifty (1.50 m) between 2 people. Any breach is punishable by a fine of 75 to 200 euros for a first offense. In the event of a repeat offense, the fine is 200 to 600 euros. If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other public outdoor spaces
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

If the breaches are reported more than three times within thirty working days from the day on which the first breach was committed, the fine is from 1000 to 2250 euros.

description: Effective June 2 and until further notice, Monaco decided that swimming pools can reopen, but only to sports practitioners. Measures to respect: (1) snacks and hydration are managed individually; (2) no sharing of personal effects; (3) favorize personal equipment (common equipment is cleaned between each use); (4) no more than 5 people for organized gatherings; (5) set up a transparent protective screen or, if impossible, equip staff with a visor for activities with customers; (6) distance benches by 1.50 m; (7) increase the volume of fresh air supply to at least 80% without reducing it at night and degrease and disinfect the ventilation systems and change the filters; (8) maintain an active chlorine rate of 0.8 to 1.4 mg / L in the ponds and maintain the footbaths at the chlorination rate of 3 to 4 mg / L; (9) limit to 1 person/4m² of surface area open to the public; (10) limit the number of people in the changing rooms to 1 person/4m2; (11) distance of 1.50 m between users; (12) bathers' behavioral rules are respected and encourage hand washing when entering and leaving changing rooms; (13) condemn one in two showers if shared showers; (14) no hair dryers; (15) always use swimming lines; (16) no groups of more than 2 people on beaches around pools. Sports halls, saunas, hammams and jacuzzis are closed. Any breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 euros the first time, 200-600 euros the second time and 1000-2250 euros if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days. UPDATE: The policy ends on June 6, because swimming pools can now open to everyone.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other public facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective June 2 and until further notice, Monaco decided that swimming pools may reopen, but only to sports practitioners. Measures: (1) snacks and hydration are managed individually; (2) no sharing of personal effects; (3) personal equipment is privileged and common equipment is cleaned before and after each use; (4) no more than 5 people for organized gatherings; (5) set up a transparent protective screen or, if impossible, equip staff with a visor for activities with customers; (6) adapt benches to respect 1.50 m of distance; (7) increase fresh air supply to at least 80% without reducing it at night and degrease and disinfect the ventilation systems and change the filters; (8) maintain an active chlorine rate of 0.8 to 1.4 mg / L in the ponds and maintain the footbaths at the chlorination rate of 3 to 4 mg / L; (9) limit to 1 person/4m² of surface area open to the public; (10) limit the number of people in the changing rooms to 1 person/4m2; (11) distance of 1.50 m between users; (12) bathers' behavioral rules are respected and encourage hand washing when entering and leaving changing rooms; (13) condemn one in two showers if shared showers; (14) no hair dryers; (15) always use swimming lines; (16) no groups of more than 2 people on beaches around pools. Sports halls, saunas, hammams and jacuzzis are closed. Any breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 euros the first time, 200-600 euros the second time and 1000-2250 euros if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days. UPDATE: The policy ends on June 6, because swimming pools can now open to everyone.

description: Effective May 11 and until May 25, the Monaco CHPG authorizes the resumption of visits to residences for the elderly in Monaco (CRIII, Cap Fleuri, A Qietüdine). Visits will only be authorized for relatives, once a week after making an appointment. The visit will take place in the room between 2 p.m. and 6 p.m. and should not last more than an hour. Families should not come in case of fever, cough or contact with an affected person. Visitors will wear a mask, have a hydro-alcoholic solution at their disposal and will use a dedicated elevator before going to the resident's room (with a few exceptions, especially if there is a double room). UPDATE: On May 22, the CHPG announced that this policy will go on until further notice. The policy finally ends on June 7. More visits are now authorized.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People in nursing homes/long term care facilities,Other population not specifed above

description: From June 8 and until further further notice, Monaco decided that the following establishments can welcome children under the age of 6: (1) care establishments and services ensuring non-permanent family care of children at home childminders; (2) reception establishments managed by a parents' association; (3) reception establishments which exclusively welcome children over 2 years old; (4) reception establishments of 10 places. Measures to respect: (1) only 1 parent per child can enter; (2) take the temperature, on arrival, of staff and children; (3) wash children's hands and faces as often as possible; (4) staff have enough masks and hydro-alcoholic products and wash their hands frequently; (5) soap and hygienic means of drying in toilets; (6) clean and disinfect frequently; (7) avoid using toys difficult to clean; (8) favor outside activities; (9) form small groups (10 children/group if possible); (10) no event bringing together adults and children; (11) wearing a mask for all those over 5; (12) hydro-alcoholic product at entrances, toilets and where necessary; (13) at the entrance, a reminder of barrier gestures and the maximum number of people; (14) distance of 1.50 m between people; (15) a direction of circulation; (16) ventilation in perfect condition; (17) dry disinfectant welcome mats where carpet is; (18) ventilate regularly. breaches are punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2d time and 1000-2250 € if more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective June 12 and until further notice, Monaco decided that performance halls, theaters and cinemas can reopen to the public. Measures to respect: (1) 1 person/4 m², staff included; (2) transparent protective screen or, if impossible, equip staff with a visor for customer activities; (3) favorized dematerialized tickets; (4) disposable equipment for visitors (or clean and disinfect equipment after use); (5) favorize smartphone applications for guided tours; (6) agent in front of the attraction points; (7) limit free entertainment and screening rooms; (8) limit the number of spectators to respect the sanitary distance of 1.50 m; (9) adapt placement to respect the sanitary distance of 1.50 m; (10) clean and disinfect after each session; (11) limit travel during intermission; (12) organize the exit to avoid a crowd; (13) wearing a mask in enclosed spaces for all those aged 5 and over; (14) hydro-alcoholic products where necessary; (15) at the entrance, a reminder of barrier gestures and the number of people authorized; (16) 1.50 m between people is respected and materialized on the ground; (17) a direction of movement is materialized by signage; (18) ventilation is in perfect condition; (19) dry disinfectant welcome mats are installed where there is carpet; (20) prefer payment by credit card; (21) ventilate as soon as possible. A breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2nd time and 1000-2250 € if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of June 15 and until further notice, Monaco decided that gyms may reopen if their operator has validated by the Director of Health Action the protocol including the health measures put in place, in particular the cleaning plan and reinforced disinfection. Other measures to be observed: (1) favor reservations; (2) keep a list of visitors for 14 days, in order to be able to trace and isolate a possible positive case and its contacts; (3) 1 person / 4 m² is allowed simultaneously; (4) wearing of a mask is obligatory for the members (except during the exercises) and for the personnel (except during a course or the exercise); (5) distance of 1.50 m between workspaces; (6) limit use to equipment that can be easily cleaned; (7) disinfect equipment before and after each use; (8) for group lessons, consider marking on the ground so that each person has a space of 4 m²; (9) one person for 4 m² can access the collective changing rooms; (10) limit the number of lockers to the maximum number of visitors, spaced 1.50 m apart; (11) supplying the showers in the changing rooms with soap using automatic dispensers; (12) condemn one in two showers; (13) no hair dryers. A breach is punishable by a fine: 75-200 € the 1st time, 200-600 € the 2nd time and 1000-2250 € if it is more than 3 times within 30 working days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective 9January, Monaco announced that all of the Principality’s shops will be open to external visitors (nationals, residents, those who work in the Principality and those who can show proof of a hotel reservation), non-residents who are not able to provide an essential reason for entering the country access would be restricted. Measure: (1) Ensuring that a safe distance of 1 m between people is maintained; (2) Adhering to a maximum capacity of one person per 4 m2 (in shops open to the public, including employees); (3) Limiting capacity to one person per 10 m2 in the common areas of shopping centres; (4)  Indicating shop capacities on notices placed at the entrance; (5) Managing access to healthcare practices, hairdressing salons, etc. using an appointment system; (6) Introducing directional floor signage and markings to avoid queues at tills.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective from 3 May, Monaco announced that the restaurants are open for lunch and dinner services. Measures: (1)The lunch service is open to residents, employees and people staying in a hotel in the Principality; (2) The evening service is open only to residents and people staying in a hotel in Monaco Reservation obligation in restaurants and tables of 6 maximum; (3) Take-out is allowed until 9 p.m. from April 19; (4) The home meal delivery activity is authorized between 6 a.m. and 10 p.m.; (5) Distance between restaurant tables of at least 1.5 meters.
